TermDefinition.DefinitionText: A rare, inherited disorder marked by tumors of the gastrointestinal tract and tumors that form in embryonic nervous tissue in the head, neck, and torso. Also called Carney dyad and Carney-Stratakis dyad.

MediaLink.alt: Pronunciation of dictionary term "síndrome de Carney-Stratakis"

SpanishTermDefinition.DefinitionText: Trastorno hereditario raro caracterizado por tumores en el aparato digestivo (gastrointestinal) y en el tejido nervioso embrionario de la cabeza, el cuello y el torso. También se llama díada de Carney y díada de Carney-Stratakis.

RelatedInformation.RelatedExternalRef: Paraganglioma and gastric stromal sarcoma (Genetic and Rare Diseases Information Center)
